meanings.definition: To show no activity or progress.
meanings.sent1: The plant's growth was flatlining, not getting any taller.
meanings.sent2: The project's development was flatlining, stuck at the same stage for weeks.
meanings.sent3: The race was so slow, it seemed like the runners were flatlining towards the finish line.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the subject was flatlining, showing no signs of improvement.
meanings.sent5: The battery was flatlining, unable to power the device anymore.

meanings.definition: The act of a heart rate or vital sign showing a flat line on a monitor.
meanings.sent1: The doctor noticed the patient's flatlining on the monitor and rushed to help.
meanings.sent2: The nurse immediately responded to the flatlining on the patient's vital sign monitor.
meanings.sent3: The flatlining on the screen made the medical team spring into action.
meanings.sent4: The sudden flatlining on the monitor sent a wave of panic through the room.
meanings.sent5: The continuous flatlining on the screen indicated a critical situation.
